p.s: I still do have doubts.
But sure not because of my wife's plan.
I have doubts because of myself.
What if I am not enough of a man?
Just as she said?
What if I do not please the prophecie'sprophecy's' conditions and do something wrong?
The witches did not tell me very much.
What if there were details that I overheard?
But there is no time to ask Banquo.
But he was also part of the prophecy, right?
Am I even thinking correctly right now?
I need to stop.
Is not a prophecy supposed to become true either way?
Is there anything I can do wrong?
It does not matter anyways, right?
If I kill Duncan someone has to become king, right?
No matter what happens, I have to do it, even if it is only for the sake of my wife!
She is so strong, she could even kill him herself.
THAT is how strong my wife is.
But what kind of a man lets his wife do such a job?
I need to do it and I will do it.
She will remember why we belong to each other and we will have the happiest life.
She even worries about my future; of course I do not want to live my life as a coward!
I am sorry to Duncan because he is a good king and he does not deserve to be killed by a friend, but what else is left?
Nobody will see us, so we will never be found guilty.
Right?
She earned becoming my queen for her fearlessness.
She will give birth to strong boys and care for our successful family with all her love and affection she now gives to me.
I will do it.
I have to and I will!
I promise it to my strong wife!
